Technique: FORMED BY HAND; DECORATED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Jug
Description: Large ovoidal vase with narrow mouth, unmarked neck and unstable base. Paste and surface of a blackish colour. The upper third of the piece, from the taper upwards to the mouth, is decorated with bands which are filled with oblique lines forming herringbones and, higher up, with schematic zoomorphic motifs (giraffes). The whole decoration has been realised by means of a tracing wheel.
